Dear Ana McClain:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Cathrine Raftery, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Privacy and confidentiality.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4130
Section (1) An institution shall assure resident and parent privacy and
Description confidentiality and shall protect residents from exploitation.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Facility breached confidentiality.
Investigation Interviews:
Administrator was interviewed face to face at the facility on
November 25, 2024. Administrator reported she is aware of
confidentiality breach as she was involved and was the one to
report to the Client Rights Advisor. She reported she had
forwarded a calendar invite that had an additional document
attached that had Youth A’s name and unit location to a parent of
a different youth. Administrator reported when she saw the
attachment she told the parent to delete it right away and
contacted the Client Rights Department at the facility for the
breach. She reported internal corrective action plan has already
been put into place to reduce the risk of this occurring again.
Documents Reviewed:
- Email from Client Rights Advisor to MDHHS Foster
Care Worker dated November 20,2024- Client Rights
Advisor from the facility notified MDHHS Foster Care
Worker that on November 18, 2024, a treatment team
member disclosed protected health information by
forwarding a Zoom meeting invitation with an attached
Word Document. The document had Youth A’s first and last
name and the unit he lives to a parent of a different youth at
the facility.
- Facility HIPAA Breach Risk Assessment dated
November 19, 2024- Client’s Rights Advisor completed this
form as it was reported Administrator had forwarded a
Zoom meeting invitation that included Youth A’s name to
person not on his care team. It was unknown if the person
the link was forwarded had opened the document with
Youth A’s name on it as Administrator called this person
immediately to delete the information. The agency had
notified Youth A’s care team of this HIPAA Breach,
Administrator received a verbal warning and reviewed the
process.
2

- Facility Confidentiality and Release of Client
information Procedure dated June 20, 2024- All staff
must sign a statement in which they confirm their
responsibility to maintain client confidentiality and protect
information from inadvertent or unauthorized disclosures.
This includes staff having to keep client’s names
confidential that live at the facility.
- Administrator HR File- Administrator had signed the
confidentiality statement upon the time she was hired in
September 2004. Administrator did receive a written verbal
warning on November 27, 2024, due to the HIPAA breach.
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance as per interview and
documentation reviewed, Administrator sent a Zoom meeting with
an attached name of a youth that went to another parent.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
